physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and landscape in orientation. It features a woman in a striped dress. She is standing, and facing towards the left. She is holding a booklet, a camera and a handbag in her hands. In the background, there are several others seen standing on a grass patch.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of Corporal A. Silver  holding booklet, camera and handbag
